attributes.action: Provide free healthcare to Partners that do not work but look after children
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Many married/cohabiting couples have one partner that works whilst the other looks after their children. The Partner does draw any social benefits except child benefit for the children. Yet if the working partner earns over £25,000 per annum the non working partner cannot claim free healthcare/benefits even though they dont have any income.
They have to pay for pescriptions, Dental work and general health care
These non working partners may have worked before looking after the child so income into the household will be affected as well as the increased cost of bringing up a baby.
